This fixes an issue where the use of `PoolConnection::release` would later cause `Pool::close` to enter an infinite loop.

Update: I merged the suggested fix from #897

See additional details #888 
`0.01` conversions could've been easily fixed without rewriting the whole thing, there's just one edge case that needs to be handled (see 2nd commit).
I couldn't find a standalone reproducer for the issue mentioned above, however, everything works fine with my branch.

title: Fix transaction wrapper
Adding support for vector of bytea type in postgres

Adding support in macros for arrays of `bytea` in Postgres.

Closes #873

title: add 1 as true for SQLX_OFFLINE env variable
body: fixes #868

title: Replace lru-cache with hashlink
body: fix https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/747

title: Add rename_all to FromRow, add camelCase and PascalCase to all rename_all
body:
As per title.

Sample usage (from test)
```rust
#[derive(Debug, sqlx::FromRow)]
#[sqlx(rename_all = "camelCase")]
struct AccountKeyword {
    user_id: i32,
    user_name: String,
    user_surname: String,
}
```

It looks like this feature was present in a previous version / someone's intention because it was already documented (but not working).

The choice of using `camelCase` and `PascalCase` was taken for consistency with `serde` and with the existing documentation, even though heck's terminology is `mixedCase` and `CamelCase`

title: Allow chaining map / try_map
body: The same thing as #823, but a new PR because GitHub doesn't allow reopening after closing, then force-pushing to the head branch. @abonander's review feedback has been incorporated (hence the force-push).

title: fix fetch_optional for sqlite
sqlite synchronous setting
body:
Add support for "synchronous" setting in SQLite connection options.
This makes changing this setting to NORMAL (from default FULL) easy.
The NORMAL mode is even advised by SQLite documentation (and that is understandable):
> If durability is not a concern, then synchronous=NORMAL is normally all one needs in WAL mode.

title: fix clippy warnings
body: This commit fixes clippy warnings, mostly related to sqlite feature.

title: Fix path for &[NaiveTime] in query! macro
body: Fixes #840

title: Add support for bstr::BString and git2::Oid, behind feature flags
body:
This adds support for SQL conversions for the bstr::BString binary
string type, and for the git2::Oid object ID type. Both types are
encoded and decoded as bytes.

These types are database-independent and work with any database that can
handle bytes, so add tests that work with sqlite.

title: Add postgres example with test of business logic
body:
This PR adds a Postgres example based on the ideas in [this blog post](https://medium.com/better-programming/structuring-rust-project-for-testability-18207b5d0243).

We also fixed the existing postgres/todos example (2nd commit).  If you want us to pull this out into a separate PR then we can do.

If this PR is ok, then we have a stab at making an example for transactions as well, potentially using the `Acquire` trait.

title: Fix some clippy lints
Allow clippy::suspicious_else_formatting when expanding query arguments.
body:
Expanding several query arguments in the query! macro creates several `if false { ... }` statements, which in turn trigger clippy's [suspicious_else_formatting](https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#suspicious_else_formatting).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9465678/99183747-6623a600-273e-11eb-84af-fb3a6258f100.png)


This commit allows the clippy lint so users won't be disturbed by it anymore.

title: Bump version in sqlx-cli README to 0.2.0
body:
I was getting an error while running `cargo sqlx prepare` while on `sqlx` version 0.4.1:

```
error: EOF while parsing an object at line 34 column 6
```

Then I realized that I had version 0.1.0-beta.1 of sqlx-cli but 0.2.0 was released on cargo.

I upgraded to 0.2.0 and the command succeeded.

I figured that the README was mistakenly not updated with the release.

title: gh actions: sprinkle use of runtime feature name matrix to allow successful run of all jobs
body:
In the wake of submitting PR #808 I saw that the GitHub Actions workflow was failing. Though it was unrelated to the changes in that specific PR, the failure messages were similar to what I was seeing building locally, so I decided to take a look:
```
 Error:   --> sqlx-rt/src/lib.rs:9:1
   |
9  | / compile_error!(
10 | |     "one of the features ['runtime-actix-native-tls', 'runtime-async-std-native-tls', \
11 | |      'runtime-tokio-native-tls', 'runtime-actix-rustls', 'runtime-async-std-rustls', \
12 | |      'runtime-tokio-rustls'] must be enabled"
13 | | );
   | |__^

```

The current PR sprinkles-in the use of the feature name matrix in the handful of obvious places needed to allow `cargo build` invocation to succeed (by explicitly naming 'runtime${foo}').

I tested these changes one at at time (one change for each of the jobs 'test', 'postgres', 'mysql', 'mariadb', and 'mssql') in my feature branch, and confirmed that each was working before moving on to the next. In the end, the full workflow was working for all jobs.

Note that the 'mysql' test failed once (due to being a deadlock victim) during testing of of the downstream tests, but since I saw successful runs of the 'mysql' jobs both before and after that failure, I'm chalking that problem up to something unrelated. Sorry that I cannot provide additional details on it, but I didn't realize that the GitHub Actions log for that run would be deleted out from underneath me (at least not so quickly...).

title: doc: README.md: minor cleanup of section "Cargo Feature Flags"
body: Nothing too crazy: Just removal of a duplicate entry, and then move one item so that the `runtime-foo-*` entries entries for a given runtime are grouped together.

title: Fixing don't parse all attributes as `Meta`
body:
This fixes https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/774
Some other crates use non meta attributes, this crashes FromRow and Encode derive when using on the same struct.
This patch makes sure the identifier is sqlx before passing it to parse_meta.

title: Add context of where to put the offline feature
body:
By the way, the feature wasn't mentioned in README of sqlx.

This made me wonder and I looked into sqlx-cli features, I wonder why there isn't offline feature.

title: Support $NNN bind parameters for sqlite
body: The sqlite driver for sqlx currently supports only the `?` and `?NNN` bind parameter formats. However, sqlite supports additional formats as specified here: https://sqlite.org/c3ref/bind_blob.html. With this change, I propose adding support for `$NNN`, which is a subset of `$VVV`. This will make it easier for sqlx users to write queries that are supported by both sqlite and postgres.

title: Add new example for migration
body: Update migration.rs examples

title: Add runtime-actix and migrate features to readme
use futures_channel::oneshot in sqlite worker
body: This commit greatly improves performance of SQLite worker. In quick&dirty tests it not also was twice fast but also had much less CPU usage (most probably because of busy-loop removed).

title: Fixing PostgreSQL BigDecimal conversion problems
body: This test fails. Expecting `0.01`, got `0`.

title: Fix typo: add missing &pool parameter in readme
body: Hi, I think I found a typo in a code example of the readme while getting started with SQLx.

title: Fix documentation for SQLX_OFFLINE environment variable
body: Behaviour changed in #732, but docs weren't updated.

title: Improve SQLX_OFFLINE / cargo sqlx prepare workflow
body:
I've transitioned to a workflow where `SQLX_OFFLINE` is the default because it improves compile times substantially. However, it feels like this workflow is not well supported with `cargo sqlx prepare` writing the cache from cache data if `SQLX_OFFLINE` is `true`. Luckily, after #732, there's an easy way to overwrite `SQLX_OFFLINE` (before, you could only unset the env variable but that wouldn't help when it was set in `.env`).

The last commit should allow running multiple cargo commands (e.g. IDE-spawned `cargo check` + `cargo sqlx prepare`) without the risk for broken query metadata files, as long as only one of them is running in online mode.

Fix migrate! macro with no params

```
error: paths relative to the current file's directory are not currently supported

7 |     sqlx::migrate!().run(&conn).await?;

  = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info)
```

title: Add support of kebab-case enum with Postgres

title: fix(postgres): prefer parsing non-localized notice severity field
body:
In order to support PostgreSQL <= 9.5, the b'S' field of an error/notice
message was parsed. However, this field can be localized and thus parsing
can fail for instances that use a non-english locale. In version > 9.5,
the b'V' field, that is guaranteed to be in english, was added. However,
even for these versions parsing would fail as the b'S' field was also
parsed. This patch prefers b'V' over b'S' if it exists and uses a default
severity in case b'V' is not present and b'S' could not be parsed.

Fixes #734

title: TiDB compatibility: Add support to utf8mb4_bin collation
Enable support for Vec<DateTime<Utc>> w/ postgres, chrono
body: I think the TODO blocking this is stale...

title: Cleanup
body: A few small things from #735 to make sure none of this is what makes CI fail.

title: [MySQL] Fix minor issue in execute statement packet
body:
The MySQL protocol [specifies that the `iteration-count` field should always be set to 1](https://dev.mysql.com/doc/internals/en/com-stmt-execute.html), but MySQL itself [ignores the field entirely](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-server/blob/f8cdce86448a211511e8a039c62580ae16cb96f5/sql/protocol_classic.cc#L2628,L2640).  Vitess is more strict and will reject execute packets with `iteration-count` set to anything other than 1.

It sounds like they may change to mimic actual MySQL behavior, but I figured you would like to also have the protocol correction on your end, even if it is borderline pedantic :)

title: Parse additional postgres connection parameters
body: This adds the ability to parse additional parameters, mentioned in #501. It does not add the complete set of acceptable parameters from the Postgres spec, but it adds parsing capabilities for all the options sqlx supports today relating to postgres. Also adds documentation for the new parameters, as well as an example connection string that utilizes parameters as that was missing before.

title: Add `Pool::size()` and `num_idle()`
body: Closes https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/issues/700

title: Add examples to `after_connect` documentation
body: I took this from the changelog. Let me know if I should add similar examples to the other `after_` and `before_` methods.

title: Support percent-encoded socket files and more parameters in postgres connect URIs
body:
This PR improves the parsing of `PgConnectOptions` to more accurately support less common forms described by the postgres documentation, including:
- Specifying a socket path with percent encoding in the host position (e.g. `postgres://user@%2Fvar%2Flib%2Fpostgres/database`)
- Supporting more connection parameters
  - `user`
  - `password`
  - `hostaddr` (functions the same as `host`, but with an additional assertion that it must parse as an `IpAddr`)
    - The postgres documentation allows specifying multiple values for `hostaddr` which will be tried in order, but this implementation only allows one value
  - `port`
  - `dbname`

These changes allow some use cases that were previously impossible without manipulating environment variables - for example, there was previously no way to specify a socket and user at the same time.

This partially addresses #501.

title: Update some dependency versions on sqlx-core
Add ranges and range arrays types
body: This PR enables using postgres range types in `query!` macros.

title: sqlx-cli: adds the db reset and setup command
body:
Addresses #596 - Similar to the way [Phoenix](https://github.com/phoenixframework/phoenix/pull/1202/commits/502e06b521b014c6423fbd26859c21b2057fb23c) has aliases for common database operations, this adds the following commands following the same terminology.

- `sqlx db reset` - Runs the equivalent of `sqlx db drop`, `sqlx db create`, and `sqlx migrate run`. Useful when developing.
- `sqlx db setup` - Runs the equivalent of `sqlx db create` and `sqlx migrate run`. Useful when pulling an existing project with many migrations already created.

title: sqlx-core/src/mysql/types/str.rs:  str::compatible():  Added support for charset number 33 (utf8 COLLATE utf8_general_ci)
body:
I also switched that bit of the conditional to use `matches!()`, as it seemed like 3+ allowed values was starting to get a little unwieldy for a `||` chain, but I can always switch that back if desired

The actual purpose is that it enables compiling against a Vitess database :) although in theory, I'd imagine it would also enable people using `utf8 COLLATE utf8_general_ci` on a `TEXT` column with vanilla MySQL/MariaDB

title: JSON+macros example using overrides
body: Simple example of the usage of macro overrides with JSON data, following the same pattern as the todos example.

title: Support non-ASCII chars in MySQL and MSSQL credentials

Based on how postgres part does the same: https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/pull/630
Closes #597

title: reversible migrations for cli
body:
- add -r flag to migration add command which if true will generate an up and a down file
- add revert subcommand, which reverts the last migration
- add --dry-run flag to migration run command, which list the migrations that will be applied
- updates add migration to check if all migration are of same type, i.e cannot mix and match reversible and simple migrations
- add database reset subcommand which drops and creates database and applies migrations

Tested on Postgresql. Need to test on mysql and sqlite

title: Support non-ASCII chars in postgres credentials
body:
The `url` crate returns username and password portions of a URL as percent encoded ASCII strings. In order to use them for the Postgres connection, we need to decode them.

This seems to be a regression from #214.

We found this as well when connecting to a PostgreSQL DB in Azure, which uses the `username@hostname` format for all it's usernames.

title: Add support for pooling in-memory sqlite DB, enabling shared cache
body: This addresses issue #362 by enabling the shared cache for in-memory sqlite databases and generating a new unique filename per in-memory pool config. The existing implementation returns a blank database when opening a connection to the pool that has not been reused.

title: Fix incorrect bash command within sqlx-cli README
sqlite: Add basic json implementation
body: Fixes #608

title: Fix NaiveDate parse_from_str argument order
body:
The [documentation](https://docs.rs/chrono/0.4.13/chrono/naive/struct.NaiveDate.html#method.parse_from_str) specifies that `NaiveDate::parse_from_str` takes two arguments: value and format, in respective order. 

Due to this, `DATE` fields could not be read into `NaiveDate`... and I have ptsd.

body:
Allow dynamically configuring the log level of the query log. 

This is an alternative to #601.

body: Signed-off-by: Austin Bonander <austin@launchbadge.com>

title: Remove rust_decimal unnecessary dependency num-traits
body:
num_bigint::BigInt, rust_decimal::Decimal use same trait ToPrimitive from crate nums-traits(0.2).

https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/blob/9ea5ce01a2b04779203bd086e7eb1358ada70ec1/sqlx-core/src/postgres/types/decimal.rs#L2

`use rust_decimal::prelude::ToPrimitive;` is as same as `use num_traits::ToPrimitive;`

The num_traits dependency is unnecessary.

https://github.com/launchbadge/sqlx/blob/9ea5ce01a2b04779203bd086e7eb1358ada70ec1/sqlx-core/src/postgres/types/decimal.rs#L71

title: fix: allow queries that select just void to pass through macros as `()` instead of `struct { _1: () }`
body: Closes #544

title: ensure correct crates version
refactor(examples): use `select pg_notify` in postgres/listen
body:
I think `select pg_notify()` is more flexible and consistent since it takes bind parameters and the channel name is always a string so it's not folded to lowercase as with using an unquoted identifier with `NOTIFY`.

We can also demonstrate `json_build_object()` rather than quasi-quoting JSON directly.

title: fix(macros): resolve clippy lint warning
body:
cc https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/issues/5849

@jplatte could you please test if this change resolves the warning with your Clippy configuration

title: Fix outdated create_if_missing docs
(BREAKING: 0.5) patch nullable inference in Postgres using EXPLAIN
body:
BREAKING CHANGE: some columns emitted by `query!()` and `query_as!()`, primarily those brought in by a `[LEFT | RIGHT | FULL] JOIN` will become `Option<T>` where they were `T` before.

In practice breakage should be minimal as these would result in `UnexpectedNull` errors at runtime unless they were manually overridden with `foo as "foo?"` already.

However, I expect there to be edge cases that aren't covered yet, thus why we've chosen to land this in 0.5 and kick out an early alpha for testing.

* requires the `json` feature (and thus the `serde` and `serde_json` features) to always be on for `postgres` (to parse `EXPLAIN VERBOSE` output, possible formats are JSON, XML, YAML or text)

closes #367

title: cargo-sqlx-cli: Fix exiting with 0 on failure
body: And also update the console dependency so it no longer gets compiled twice (0.10 direct, 0.11 indirect).

title: Embedded migrations
body:
This PR implements embedded migrations with a new `migrate!` macro. The macro takes an optional string literal for specifying the migrations directory, which defaults to `"migrations"`. It expands to a static instance of `Migrator`.

```rust
sqlx::migrate!().run(&pool).await?;
```

Addresses #550
